availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William A. Petit (Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Milly H. Pettit. Married to Elizabeth Highfill Pettit in Pendleton County, Kentucky, on January 10, 1838. Father of Margaret Pettit, Sarah Pettit, Zachariah Pettit, John M. Pettit, Hetta Pettit, Martha M. F. Pettit, and William H. Pettit. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1850. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 1, p. 357B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 559.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, 1827-1847, Film #000272805, p. 421 and 448 of 475 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
